citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, the licensee was unable to provide required records for review. Due to the facility exhibiting
in travel status most of the year, the licensee keeps their records book with them while on the road. During today’s
inspection, the transport vehicle was not present at the facility, preventing review of these records. The inspection of
essential records at a facility ensures they are operating as required involving the animals exhibited by the facility. The
facility shall ensure that records required by the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) and animal welfare regulations are available
for APHIS officials to review on all inspections.
Correct by December 9, 2024.

Upon inspection, no water was available for a total of twenty-seven dogs housed at the facility. Though the licensee
stated the water bowls were all filled prior to the inspection and had been consumed since then, the six dogs housed in
the front room of the home and remaining dogs located outdoors for exercise opportunities had empty water receptacles
during the time of inspection.
Constant access to potable water is necessary to ensure that dogs remain hydrated as needed throughout the day. The
facility must ensure that all dogs have continuous access to potable water, unless restricted by the attending veterinarian
or excepted as provided in 3.17(a).
The licensee corrected during the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
